qas.question: Who was Paris' first director of parks and gardens?
How many new parks have been created in Paris since 1977?
WHen was the Parc de la Villette created?

answers.text: Promenade des Berges de la Seine

qas.question: When was the Promenade des Berges de la Seine built?

context: Between 1853 and 1870, the Emperor Napoleon III and the city's first director of parks and gardens, <a0_0>Jean-Charles Alphand<a0_0/>, created the Bois de Boulogne, the Bois de Vincennes, Parc Montsouris and the Parc des Buttes-Chaumont, located at the four points of the compass around the city, as well as many smaller parks, squares and gardens in the Paris' quarters. Since 1977, the city has created <a1_0>166<a1_0/> new parks, most notably the Parc de la Villette (<a2_0>1987<a2_0/>), Parc André Citroën (1992), and Parc de Bercy (1997). One of the newest parks, the <a3_0>Promenade des Berges de la Seine<a3_0/> (<a4_0>2013<a4_0/>), built on a former highway on the Left Bank of the Seine between the Pont de l'Alma and the Musée d'Orsay, has floating gardens and gives a view of the city's landmarks.
